text: Being from California I tend to be a Mexican food snob, but I kept an open mind when I walked in. First off the service was mediocre. They seated us immediately, but we did not get table service for at least 10 minutes. My daughter ordered an iced tea and we didn't get it until after the food arrived and we had asked three different people to get it. The fish tacos were dry, the chips were stale and the quesadilla was fair. Perhaps it was an off night for the kitchen staff, but I am guessing this is normal. I should have known when every other restaurant in the area had a 30 minute wait and we walked right in to this establishment. This was not the Mexican food I was looking for and suffice it to say we won't be back. I only gave it two stars because the gal that waited on us was sweet and overworked.

This may be the worst Mexican restaurant in the country. The margaritas tasted like bad, watered down lemonade and were $11 for a 16 ouncer. The 'highly recommended' nachos were served with ballpark nacho (plastic) cheese and were turned to liquid in minutes. Head back into the city and find something better/cheaper.
The view lured us in but I truly wish we hadn't caved. The food was horrible, the service was slow and the prices were very steep.

This was such an experience i needed to write about it. First off it it was my grandmothers birthday and she wanted fireworks, so we said why not navy pier. We got there and every restaurant had a wait for big parties. But chongo loco took us right away and they were busy also.  When we sat down we were immediately greeted by our server gasper. Amazing guy And then the water was  Placed quickly on the table by a very smiling irishman. Gasper was very attentive, asking us where we were from and whats our occasion,  and then right into his dialogue. Explaining all the drinks and food. He was,a great sales man. My kids loved him. He was positive and not one mistake.  Trust me we are very picky and the children are always ready to make it hard,  but he was great. I was surprised how great the food was and how quickly it came out. Drinks amazing. I recommend the margaritas.  Pitchers. And then to top it off beautiful fire works. Very happy we found you chongo loco. New fav spot at navy pier . Thank you to gasper and all the staff who made this day a great memory. We will be back and we,will be telling our friends.  Thanks guys
The food was barely food. One of the worst restaurant experiences I've had. The beer tasted like sugar water, and the chips were paper like, the fish tacos tasted like soggy dead fish.

I see 2 stars but my experience was much better. I tried the fried Chicken tacos so much food,  very good my girlfriend tried the burger it was also very good. service was very fast. Margaritas hit the spot for a hot day.

Horrible. Will never ever come here again. Order Pepsi taste like it has salt in it ! Chicken quesdells I ask for no sour cream and they put it on top. Enchadaldas to cheesy and nasty taste. So many waiters and waitress and only one man delivering the food. I wish I could give it a worse rating. 42 dollars for two plates. Unbelievable. They joke around and play with each other at work really unprofessional.
Definitely not worth the wait. The only thing authentic is the wait. For the price you would think the food would be a LOT more flavorful. Most likely will never come back.

Here on business, from Dallas, TX... Where to stary, hummm.. make it simple. Pros: at the Pier, out/in door opt's, friendly staff, awesome music, clean area & good selection on food/drinksm Cons: chips & salsa are ok, we asked two employees about "chicago best margarita" as advertised... the Ultimate Margarita ($12) at 16oz and $50 for 64 oz. before i post my comments, just wanna say everyone has there own taste buds comments: being Ultimate, the glass didnt show it was (the water glass was better appealing). Tastenof back: water like (claim they have patron silver) but this Grand Marnier Floater tastes more.  botton line, will not order it nor recommend it.. but again.. your taste buds are different.

My parents and I stopped her for lunch after an amazing boat tour this past Memorial Day weekend and lets just say the whole experience was pretty much sub par.  To start off we sat at our table for a good 10 minutes before a single person greeted us. When our server finally came over, he was unable to answer ANY questions we had regarding the menu (which granted he may have been new, but that is part of your homework is to know the menu front and back). After our drinks took probably another 10 plus minutes, we told him we were ready to order and he said he'd be right back... Surprise Surprise.... we had to wait AGAIN for another 10 or so minutes until we reminded him.  So we gave him the order.... 30 minutes pass and every table around us has their food (some of them came in after us) and we don't have ours. The sever goes back to "check with the kitchen" and comes back to tell us that the "ticket never went through". Now I used to work in a restaurant setting and I understand sometimes mistakes happen, but you are ALWAYS best to just own up to your mistakes. We were VERY AWARE that he had just forgotten to put our food in, because the food was clearly not made "on the fly" and we were never confronted by a manager of any sorts, so he just never told anyone of authority.  When we finally received out food, it was just really lacking flavor and honestly not that hot. I think the thing that really just rounded this out as a bad experience is that with 3 dishes and a margarita pitcher our bill was over $120. WAY TOO PRICEY for the experience. We spent less with an amazing view up in the signature room on the 96th floor of the John Hancock.  If you haven't already gathered, I would just definitely not suggest wasting your money at this place. Even the view isn't worth the money.

After standing in front of the hostess for 10 minutes without being acknowledged we decided to take our business elsewhere. For being in such a central location with so much competition you would think Management would make an effort to have welcoming and competent people to greet and welcome guests. We moved on and I hope some changes are made so this doesn't happen to anyone else!

I wish i could give 0 star. Been there for first time today and waited in the line for more than an hour to have the seat. Chips were so cold and salsa was too sweet, literally pathetic. And the food was also not great. I don't recommend it. Please don't go and save your precious time.

Food blah at best. Drink was really frozen. Couldn't drink it. Needed a microwave. They fixed it though, watered it down nicely.  Nachos had liquid cheese product that you can only find at the finest ball parks. We had good service.

Location, location, location! This place is the perfect location for the summer nights! Food is good. Service is good. The view is great! I think it's great when you come with the "I'm gonna have a great night" attitude.  We ordered a variety of tacos and they were great! Fish was fresh, the steak was tasty. I think we're gonna look into having a party here another time.

I usually don't give any place one star but this place deserves it really. Such a disappointment for such a great location. They had sooooo many open tables. But they still made us wait. Once we got seated it took them 30 minutes to finally get us a server. This was after us asking the bus boy and host like 4 times. Finally come we got our server(Alicia) we placed our order. She recommendeded the fondido. I am going to go ahead and say, never get the fondido at this place. It's overpriced, bland and not at all appetizing. Alicia was an alright server but way too slow with the service. Probably because of the number of tables she was waiting. Anyway, this spoiled our Navy Pier evening. I recommend staying away from this place. Overpriced, terrible service, worse Mexican food and small portions.

Chango Loco is the pinnacle of class and culture  located like a prized jewel on Chicago's delightful Navy Pier.  The service, drinks, and food (most especially the chips and salsa, delivered often and at no extra charge) were all top notch. This was one of the better dining experiences of my short life -- I can only hope to repeat the likes of it at some point in my future, though a long and arduous search might be likely for that to occur.  In closing, might I just note that Chango Loco is more than a mere restaurant...it's an institution.

This is probably one of the worst restaurants I have been too in awhile.  When we decided to have lunch yesterday, we looked at the restaurants at the directory and were excited to eat at a "cantina".  We were immediately seated at a table and didn't have to wait to get a table.  Then we were given two glasses of water in clear plastic cups and it was warm with no ice.  We then ordered two items; one a cobb salad and the other a mango chicken taco salad.  Both items arrived out pretty quick and we were saddened to find out that the salads were filled with white lettuce.  I was even more upset that my taco salad didn't come in a taco bowl but had three thin stripes of tortilla on the top for the "taco" portion.  The food tasted pretty bland overall and the pricing for what we ordered wasn't great.

I was initially going to give this place 2 stars; the second would have been for the great view of Navy Pier & the river. Then I realized, I could have had that same view by ordering from the $1 menu at the nearby McDonalds...so 1 star it is! Food: Blah at best. I ordered the chicken tacos, which had very little seasoning. My friend ordered a burrito, which also failed to meet her expectations.  Service 1: Very mediocre, and leaves a lot to be desired. We saw chips/salsa on several other tables, but our waitress hadn't brought them or offered...so we assumed they were an additional charge (which would have been ridiculous for a Mexican restaurant). After our food came, I finally asked if they came with our food order. She replied, "I can get you some if you like." I asked her if there was an additional charge. She replied, "No, they're complimentary." *irritated face* So apparently they're complimentary IF you ask for them. Ridiculous.  Service 2: One of my biggest pet peeves is when a server fails to give me the proper change from my bill. She shorted me 50 cents, and never said a word about it. Yes, it's a small amount but proper restaurant etiquette would dictate that you at least mention it to me if you don't have any coins available.  I should have known by how few people were dining here what we'd be in for:  Bad food. Bad service. Bad choice.

Can I do zero stars or is that just rude. The good is they had open tables. The real is there is a good reason they had open tables. The queso was a ball of grease and hard cheese, the nacho chips were stale. The service was fine but the experience was horrible. We had to go eat dinner after this dinner because nobody could finish their plates.

Do Not Eat Here!  Even at Navy Pier you can find better Mexican food, heck, even Margaritaville is better. We were in a rush and ate here before a fireworks sail.  Let's start with the good - it was clean, the staff were friendly and efficient.  Now the rest - margaritas - way way way too much sour. Menu mentions 'a touch of sour' when it's mostly sour. For $14 you could get some actual lime juice in there. Food was just bland and boring. Guacamole was not fresh.  Tater tots with one burger were so salty as to be unedible.  Tacos were just bland.  Chicken burritto had very little flavor. Do yourself a favor and hit anyplace else. There are a number of good local spots with Navy Pier outlets - go there. I'm really sorry I did not check the yelp reviews before we sat down. I could have saved us $150 in very forgettable food.
Very good food. The problem is that service, is only students.  Really I'm appreciate this place.

Not a favorite at all! Server was nice everyone friendly but food was bland.... We ordered a margarita pitcher and didn't finish it because it was not worth it. Do not order the margaritas. Portions were good size but no one finished there meal because we were not impressed...A lot was wasted. Came here on our stay in Chicago for our anniversary and we won't return. :(

I loved the food. I had the Nachos Locos. It was so much and I was very happy with the portion size. I had 3 picky eater kids with me. They loved their crispy hot tater tot, hot dogs and cheeseburger. My friend love her stuffed burrito. All the food was hot and huge portion sizes. The food came about 10 minutes after ordering but we had salsa and chips. The waitress was nice and checked on us every few minutes. I think we received a lot of food for the price. I will be back because it was a good experience.

I wish I would have read the reviews before coming here but my boyfriend and I were starving that we didn't even think of looking this place up beforehand. Although the seating outside was really nice, their food was not so great. I ordered their burrito and for some odd reason they put tomato sauce and melted mozzarella cheese on top of it. I'm not sure if it was suppose to come like that or if the lady got my order wrong. I told the lady I wanted the rice in my burrito and when my food arrived the rice wasn't in there. The chicken in the burrito tasted as if it was completely dried out like a reheated taste. This place is no where near authentic. Their guacamole was okay but I mean who can mess up guacamole. My boyfriend ordered their cheeseburger and he said it was okay. Portion sizes are huge as they serve a big portion of tater tots with the burgers. My burrito came with a big portion of rice and beans on the side. I don't like how my boyfriends burger came out first then my burrito came out by the time he finished his burger. They should have served it together like a normal restaurant. I feel like this place is overpriced especially because of the quality of the food. I don't recommend coming to eat hear. Not authentic what so ever. I would not return.

I came here to Navy Pier on vacation with my wife to make a pit stop and have a drink. We were greeted right away and sat at the bar. The bartender was very kind and was quick to offer us a drink. My wife had a Michelada and I had a Margarita.  We  are both from Los Angeles, work in service and sales, and know a thing or two about Mexican food, it's' alcoholic beverages, and  customer service.  Our drinks tasted great. They also brought us chips and salsa which was ice and tasted good. We decided to order food and we tried out their steak fundido. This was very delicious and was cooked just right so the steak was soft, and the cheese was melted perfectly. One other thing I noticed all of the employees are of Latin decent and had an accent. Since it rained they all kept busy cleaning up the outside deck, usually when business is slow but your staff keeps working is a good sign of customer service, I used to b a manager FYI. I'd come back again!

On June 18, 2016 we were scrambling to get 30 volleyball players, families and coaches a place to enjoy a meal together. Since the tournament was at Navy Pier and the weather was so beautiful we thought an outdoor location  there would be ideal. Good luck with that on a summer Saturday right? We were fortunate to come across the GM Pete and his team at Chango Loco by the Crystal Ballroom. They could not have been more accommodating. As they could work it out they assembled us in a beautiful area. Wendy and Angel were our service team and were very patient and pleasant herding our group of cats. Every meal and Margarita was great and we had the best night of our trip there. Thanks for making a very memorable and delicious experience. Well worth it.

Worst Mexican food i have ever had....horrid service, terrible food.  These idiots can't even make a cocktail.  How is this place open?  Tourists who don't know better, that's the only thing it can be.
Not good at all. Everything was very bland and you could tell it was all pre-made. Very disappointing.
Overpriced and food is mediocre at best. I would not recommend to friends or family to visit this place. The only pro was the waitress we had was friendly, but that alone wouldn't bring me back.
Pretty bad overall for such a great location. Guacamole was bland and the Salsa dip was extremely watery with no flavour.
Came in for cocktails and were met with free chips and salsa. Nothing too fancy but that's not what we were looking for.

Our server was great! Taco Bells food is better and more Mexican than this place! The second level seating was a nice view of the city.  Food came in a timely manner. It aas cold and terribly awful. Hot meals were cold except for the enchiladas was was microwave too hot! Food got very cold after like 8 minutes.  Avoid this place at all cost.

Just stopped in for a drink, chips and salsa before the our river boat cruise.  We had 20 minutes and we got in and got out just fine.  The chips and salsa were better than average but the margarita was only average.  Quick service though, which was my top priority, and the bar is located in an indoor park with trees and what not.  Pretty scenic...

The service was super slow. The food was mostly terrible. The beans were decent and the tater tots were good.  We had a four year old with us who wanted cheese dip but they apparently don't have plain cheese dip which totally bummed her out.
Terrible. Especially when compared to all your other choices at navy pier. Don't waste your time.

Service was SUPER slow on a Tuesday afternoon. Got seated right away, took 20 minutes for a server to come up to us and ask for our drinks and order.  My boyfriend and I decided on sharing a steak dish.  We said steak, we looked at our server and said steak.... What did we get? Chicken. Automatically I told the busboy please take this back we asked for steak.  We sat there 15 minutes not knowing if our proper dish was being made. After getting the steak dish 15 minutes later after the chicken the waiter came up to us to apologize. When we got the check we were charged for the chicken and then there was a credit for the chicken dish.  Well we never ordered a chicken dish so that charge shouldn't have ever been on our check. Even though we got a credit for it, we never ordered it so why was it on our check?  I was going to go up to the manager. But he seemed to be the only one working hard.  SERVERS NEED TO LEARN TO MULTITASK. I watched the servers work, and seriously? Do two or more things at the same time.  I watched my server with so much frustration. Not going her again unless it's a take out order. Food was good, my boyfriend and I liked the food.

Stopped by for a snack and ended up ordering their nachos. Most orders of nachos are big, but this was just overly huge...felt wasteful because I am sure even a table of 4 (we were a table of 2) could not finish it. As far as the taste, the nachos were okay. There was a lot of cheese and beans which made it very filling. They gave us a teeny tiny to-go style container with salsa. It was good but not anywhere near enough. If they gave us more salsa I think it would have made a huge difference with the nachos since they were pretty dry. The main thing going for this place is the location since it is inside of the Crystal Gardens. If you are already there it's a decent place to go to, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
The fanfare & service probably would out do the food here. Although I must try more of the cuisine. But still, A great place to relax & hang out.
First let me say I was pleased with the food. It was good. The service was slow, but it looked like they were super busy and understaffed. Made for not such a great experience.

The margaritas are not good at all. The wine was served in a plastic cup. Our waiter was nice, but once we got our drinks he never came to check on us and it was not busy so that was not the reason. We finally had to flag another waitress down to get our check. Only giving it 2 stars because it's a great location/view. Would not go back.

We were initially less than impressed with the simply decor but it was relaxed with a good view. The Initial chips and salsa were better than expected with firm chips and spicy salsa. The Tres Tacos with flour tortilla substituted for the corn were delicious. Very happy with our lunch decision.

The worst dinner I have ever paid for. Food was bland and just smothered in pathetic salsa. The entire meal was microwaved. Mushy. Not to mention Im pretty sure i got sick from the food too. Ugh. This place should be closed.
The food is BAD! But the service is good! I won't recommend this place, only if you want to enjoy the skyline and a glass of water!
I never thought Mexican food could be bland...I was wrong. Food essentially sucked, service was sub par. I will never eat here again.

For being right on the lake at navy pier, we were very disappointed with service and food portions.  Waited 15 mins for a refill on a Dixie cup of ice with a splash of Pepsi, next time we will gladly take the $80.00 to margarita ville

We were lured here by a sign telling of the best Margs in Chicago.  They forgot to add alcohol. Food was OK, nothing special. Service was polite, friendly and fast -- no issues there. They have a kids menu, but nothing to keep them occupied.

The "Ulitmate Margarita" was horrible. Indescribable flavor. We sent it back and the waiter knew why before we said anything. The Dos Equis on tap was great. The salsa was great and our meals were excellent. Fish tacos, chicken quesadillas and the Mozz sticks came with some amazing tater tots. Over all very good. Would go again.

Navy Pier is crazy expensive, but this restaurant is not to bad. Yes, a bit overpriced, but it was ok. Service was good, our waitress was very nice. I could see service being bad if this placed was packed which wasn't when we are here. Very young waitresses and people who cleaned out table and gave us water. It was clean. Menu was not a lot, but they had their options. I like it being on the second floor so good view outside. 4 stars, but 5 stars for hard working waitresses and waiters who were super polite and nice.

Came here with low expectations. And I hadn't read any reviews before we arrive. Fortunately our experience was better than a lot of other people. We arrived mid-afternoon and the joint was mostly empty. We were seated immediately and the waitress was very pleasant. My wife who is from Mexico City said the fajitas were "excellent." My cheese enchiladas arrived on a plate completely smothered in cheese. I didn't see the tortillas. They were buried.  The cheese was very good but it was 90% cheese and 10% everything else. Nothing close to authentic. She had piña colada that was fair to middling while I had a 16 oz. Dos Equis. So we lucked out. But I probably wouldn't return because I'd be afraid I'd have a bad experience like a lot of others.

Nothing really positive to say.  The service sucked.  The chips and salsa were nothing to write about.  The margaritas tasted like they poured some bottled mix in with some horrible tequila.  Needless to say we didn't finish our meals but signed off on an overpriced lunch.

We gathered the family together for the Cirque Shanghai show and decided to meet for dinner on Navy Pier.  This restaurant was much better than we had expected.  The service was great, the food is delicious, the price was right, the location was unbelievable.  Can't wait to go again.  I will be telling ALL of my friends.   This is the exact kind of dining experience that I have been looking for.

Stopped here a couple of days ago with a friend - I ended up with a chicken wrap and she had a burrito. Meh. Food was plentiful, but bland at best. Hello!  If you want BLAND food, would you choose a Mexican restaurant? I don't think so. But, the chips and salsa were pretty good, the beer was cold, the view from the upper level patio was good, and unlike every other place on Navy Pier, it was half empty and had no wait. Maybe this last part should have tipped us off.  Anyway, went back a couple of days later with a few more friends, and; 1) Had to seat ourselves. Stood at the entrance in front of the PLEASE WAIT TO BE SEATED SIGN for 5 minutes with no help in sight, looking at a bunch of empty patio tables, and finally just sat ourselves.  2) Had the waitress finally come up and say "Oh. Did you seat yourselves?" with that look like, how dare you?  3) Then she asked whether we were eating or just drinking, and when we told her we going to have a couple of drinks and may or may not eat, she said "Oh, well you'll need to sit out there near the entrance. This area is for dining only." We couldn't believe it. We were surrounded by empty tables and really, could have gone anywhere on the pier for a drink. We were doing them a favour by wanting to spend our money there. Plus, two of us had just eaten there a couple of days before, and we all would probably have ordered dinner after our drinks anyway. They were just real dicks about it. So we asked to speak to the manager. After a brief confab - in spanish, right in front of us at though we weren't even there - he agreed that we were fine where we were.  4) So we think that's settled, finally. Except then nobody would serve us!! We could see the waiters standing in a group about 30' from us, looking our way and talking, but no one would come to our table. We eventually got up and left.  So in summary, I would DUMPSTER DIVE before every going back to this place. Seriously, only go here if you have a deep sense of self-loathing. For all those who gave this place more than a single star: there is a famous bronze statue of Bob Newhart (from the psychiatry sitcom, not the New England innkeeper sitcom), complete with psychiatrist's couch, right at the entrance to Navy Pier. Go lay on that couch and get some therapy!

People definitely don't come here for the food, but for its location.  Food and drinks at Navy Pier are overpriced in general and that's something you just have to expect.  Chango is situated on the upper level near the Ferris wheel and carousel.   We waited about 15 minutes for table for about 10 people.  I thought it would have taken longer as there were a lot of people in line.   The outdoor seating area provides a nice view of the lake and the skyline.  It's also a great spot to see the fireworks on display at Navy Pier on Wednesdays and Saturdays during the summer.  There's a canopy that would protect from light rain. The food here is decent.  The complimentary chips and salsa were good.  The alcoholic beverages are watered down.   The waiter is friendly and attentive. 3 fish tacos - $12 Chicken quesadillas - $11 Pitcher of sangria (approximately 5 glasses) - $32 The closet bathrooms are located either right downstairs or in the red building near the Ferris wheel.

I had low expectations for the food, which was ok. It's navy pier people...not an authentic Mexican restaurant.  However, the service was ridiculously bad.  Ordered nachos (and a meal). Took 15min or our drinks to come...then quesadillas... Wait, we didn't order that "did you put the order in wrong?" "No, I'm not sure what is going on with the kitchen". "Waiter, are they coming?" Yes he says. Never checked. Never came. He said he "took care of it" for us. Lucky us not having to pay for nachos we never got. Oddly enough, we WERE charged for nachos. Nuff said.

I ordered a Cobb Salad yesterday, and i wasn't even half way through and found a SCREW, yes- a piece of metal. Apparently, it fell off from a tomato slicer. It doesn't make sense because they would slice the tomato somewhere else and transfer the food after, so they should have noticed that. The manager came and tried to make it up by asking me if he can buy me anything, but i didn't get anything because i lost my appetite already that i didn't want anything from that place. People there are nice, but they don't seem to be very careful with what they serve. It was my first time at Navy Pier and had the worst experience with the food.

Horrible. Not authentic Mexican. Food is under seasoned. The $12 margarita tasted like tequila I made in my toilet. The Jalapeno peppers here are like super screaming hot. My family member had a burger that they enjoyed. The fact that a mexican restaurant served a burger should have been warning number one.

My husband and I were wanting Mexican after a long day of walking. He ordered a crazy monkey to drink, I'm not sure if they even added alcohol. I had a margarita, hard to mess that up. We both ordered the grande burrito with steak. I was not a fan, but my husband liked his. I did not like the whole beans or the flavor of the beans. I would not come back.

Give this place a miss. There is a reason that this place is not busy. The food tastes like a frozen microwave dinner. The staff rude. They were slow with the check. You are better off at the local Taco Bell. It's a shame yelp won't let you give a no star rating. I guess that one star will do, it does have a nice view.

We came here for a quick snack. We all shared an appetizer of jacked up nachos (cheese, olives, tomatoes, onions, ground beef, and hot peppers) and the tri-guacamole (regular, mango, and spicy guacamole). Both were really good, but my favorite (and most of the tables favorite) was the mango guacamole. I think that the majority of the time we kept on saying how great it was and trying to figure out how to make it ourselves. It's a definite must if you ever visit Chango Loco.

Just stopped for a quick bite outside on a semi sunny, warm day. The food was ok... Guacamole flights were good. Service was ok. Fish tacos were alright but I've had better. Overall a mediocre experience, good but nothing to write home about.

Blah food, mediocre service. We should have walked out when my wife couldn't get anything prepared to her specifications. Apparently, everything is made beforehand & just heated up when ordered. A big waste of time & money.

A while back I wrote a review for Fajita Grill in Westbrook, ME and gave if 3 starts for not serving impressive enough Mexican food..... However, this place is far worth, and in fact, the worst Mexican place I've ever been to. I used to think that Mexican food was so flavorful that you can't really mess it up. But I was wrong. The chips and salsa were absolutely awful: much much worse than the bagged chips we can buy from Walmart. They werer not crispy but rather firm. I am 80% certain that they weren't fresh made. My mom and I ordered one of their specials (which turned out wasn't so special after all) and one salad. The salad wasn't really Mexican. But I really wasn't expecting much out of a restaurant by the famous Navy Pier. So I'll give the salad a pass. The special came with 3 jumbo shrimps (which were pretty good I'd have to say), and a slice of steak, served with rice, beans and guacamole. All the side orders were OK. But the steak was way overcooked. We couldn't chew it even after cutting it into little pieces.  The service wasn't so great either: music way too loud; it took them forever to get anything. However, it does have a view as it is located on the second floor (same level as the  Ferris Wheel) by Navy Pier.

Overall good experience. This restaurant was not as busy as the first few restaurants when you enter Navy Pier which was a plus.  The drinks (soda & ice tea, in particular) were too small in my opinion for the price but the food surpassed my expectations. I ordered the chicken enchiladas & they were delicious! The sauce had a kick of spice which I prefer over the over used plain enchilada sauces. The chicken was very tender & was plentiful in the dish. The menu does not lie when they said these enchiladas are cheesy, very filling! Would definitely go back. These were some of the best enchiladas I've had to date.
Horrible food.... Is that Mexican food?  Horrible service.. Messed up the order and didn't bother to fix it.. Super expensive .. Skip it at all cost

Here's a serious tip: the flight of guacamoles, unless you like sauce added to your guac (yes, SAUCE!), don't get it.  The regular guac, while a tad under-seasoned, is just fine.  But added mango sauce to the mango guac, and some sort of smoky sauce with pepitas to the chipotle guac, was gross.  Guacamole should not be sweet, and that's what the mango-sauced guac ended up being. I added some Tapatio to help the cause, but it didn't. The tacos, while small, were quite tasty.  I had one of each:chicken, pork,and beef.  They only come with cilantro and onions, though, so I requested sides of cheese and sour cream. The addition of these two items picked up the flavor, for sure.  I didn't eat the rice or much of the beans that come with the dish, and so can't speak to those.   My 16oz margarita on the rocks, with Petron Silver, was just okay.  I got slightly buzzed.  But, that kind of makes sense if you've got 16oz with only one shot. The line looked like it would take forever, but we were seated outside, overlooking the pier and lake, within about fifteen minutes. The waitstaff was pleasant, and we left satisfied.  If you want to use the restrooms, however, they're back downstairs in the food court area - there are none in the actual restaurant.

All of Navy Pier is a tourist attraction, and so you should eat here knowing that you are at a tourist attraction, not a fine dining restaurant. I ordered the steak burrito & my friend ordered steak tacos.  We sampled each others.  Both were delicious!  Each entree comes with beans - yummy to dip the chips into - and rice which was tasty.  Free chips and salsa are delivered to the table.  The sangria is delicious!! This is a great place to visit on a summer day at Navy Pier.  You are paying to sit overlooking Navy Pier where the view is great!  Good food, good view, good price (for Navy Pier).

The wait wasn't bad considering other restaurants were over 2hrs. The drinks were good. The salsa & chips were yummy!!! The food wasn't bad~ i had 3 tacos (chicken, pork & beef) and it was really good & filling! The rice & beans were a little weird but not horrible. we did order the Chips & guacamole appetizer & it was mostly chips but it was delcious! Our server was attentive & very friendly! I'd go back

The rice was just got one big blob of salt. Salt, salt, salt, salt. I'm not talking about a little to salty taste, but literally someone poured a dozen or so extra grams of salt in everything; not just the rice but especially the rice. Waiter: "Would you like a box for that?" Me: "No thank you, it was utterly and completely disgusting." Waiter: "OK. Thanks for stopping in, please come back soon!" Me: "You bet." Whomever manages this place needs to fire the entire kitchen staff. Or maybe the owner needs to fire the kitchen manager. Something needs to change that is apparent.
Location is awesome. Views are great. Don't order the margaritas or the piña coladas...  but isn't that what you want in a Mexican cantina?  Hmm

Oh Chango. I went here cuz your name is so fun. The food however leaves less to be desired. I needed something with sustenance after a night out on the Chi-town so while my friend and I were being touristy at the Navy Pier we were intrigued by the name. So we walked the lengthy pier, doubled back, and found you Chango Loco. We didn't know at first that the restaurant means "crazy monkey" and that its mascot was in fact a crazy, possibly drunken monkey drinking Sauza Tequila. We stepped inside and had a veggie burrito and a taco salad with skirt steak. The inital chips and salsa was disappointing because somehow the chips were too dry and healthy tasting although the salsa was good. My friend thought her burrito was dry as well and needed my side of salsa to wash it down. My skirt steak was chewy and cut in tiny little pieces that were sort of rubbery. now that is loco you chango! If you do go here, take a picture of the sign, enjoy saying the name a few times, and walk back out to get some navy pier goodness (fried powdered things and hot dogs). You'd be better off!

God, what was I thinking?   I should have known better. I had a co-worker in town visitng Chicago and I thought we'd go to Navy Pier since she's been to Chicago a dozen or so times and never been to Navy Pier.  Nice evening for a walk.  We settle on Chango Loco.  What a mistake.  I ordered the Taco Salad and it was a pile of lettuce in a taco shell.  Oh, there was a little bit of cheese, guac, and sour creme.  No rice, no beans.   Ugh.  Service was good, and that's about the only thing saving this from getting zero stars.   Next time I'm going to skip ALL food at Navy Pier.

The WORST restaurant experience of my life!!  First, we came to the podium where the hostesses were and asked if there was a wait.  They said that there were no tables available outside.  I looked and saw probably 4 open tables.  I was a little confused, but then someone said, "Oh, we can sit them down over there."  The hostesses were pretty much attached at the hip.  They sat and talked and followed each other around everywhere.  I felt like I was in a high school cafeteria!  We sat down and looked at the menu and the food was way over priced for what you get.  Beans, rice, and a burrito were $11!!  It was one of the cheapest things on the menu, though, so I ordered the Vegetable Burrito.  It was supposed to have grilled vegetables, tomatoes, lettuce, and sour cream.  When we got our food, the rice was way undercooked.  We asked for new rice but the server said the whole batch was undercooked.  Instead of tossing it, they continued to serve it to the whole restaurant.  Even the tables next to us complained, but they never did anything to make it better.  Then I cut open my burrito and it had a ton of lettuce and sour cream, but almost no other vegetables.  I mean I could literally count the small diced pieces on one hand!  Who would pay $11 for a lettuce and sour cream burrito!?!?  Seriously??  So we called over the server again and asked him and he said that he'd get the manager.  After waiting about 20 minutes while watching the server come around us but wouldn't make eye contact. When we'd try to flag him down, he'd look at us and walk the other way.  So, we followed him inside and asked about the burrito.  He pointed at the manager without a word.  The manager barely gave us the time of day.  He yelled and waved his arms and said, "What do you want from me?  Here I'll give you half off the bill!"  We said that it wasn't necessary, we just wanted some grilled vegetables to go with the burrito!  He was so angry and said, "I don't have time for this!  I'm too busy!"  So, he discounted our bill and refused to give us any other food.  We got back to the table and were never helped again...even for water.  It was TERRIBLE!  I will never ever go there again.  I can't believe what happened.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!  The prices are way too high for the crappy food and service!
While checking out Navy Pier on a hot day this place provide the drinks, chips and salsa and an air conditioned bar for us to take in the soccer game. For that I am thankful, ha.

Crap, crap, crap. I have been here twice. Unfortunately. The first time the food was not that bad but the service was absolute shit. I mean, it was so bad it was not only annoying but infuriating. But, the view is good and it is the only mexican place on the pier so I went there again over Labor Day with my parents for drinks and appetizers. Service was just as bad. Food was worse. Drinks are ok. But really expensive for what they are. Even for the pier. We ate chips and salsa which was acceptable and then we got an appetizer sampler that was awful. It had chicken wings, jalapeno poppers and quesadillas. The quesadillas (just tortilla with cheese) were about the only edible thing on the plate. The other thing that was infuriating was I had promised my daughter some ice cream so my mom went down to Ben and Jerry's to get her some so she would be busy while we ate. Yeah, they wouldn't let her bring it back in. We were about to cancel our order and just leave but they finally caved. Overall I think I would rather eat a frigging hot dog from one of the pier vendors then eat here again.

This is the worst Mexican food ever!  I didn't know you could screw up Mexican food this bad. Food was so overpriced, lacked flavor, and didn't taste fresh at all. If it had been exceptional I wouldn't mind paying for it but Taco Bell is better than this place and I hate TB.  We fell in to this tourist trap because we were starving and happened to be at Navy Pier. Do yourself a big favor and avoid this place.

If you are looking for overpriced, atrocious Mexican food, this is your place.  I previously thought it was impossible to mess up Mexican food, Chango Loco proved me wrong.  I created this yelp account to warn the masses about this utter failure.

Count me as another Yelper who registered just to warn everyone to stay away.  Here are several reasons NOT to eat at this establishment. 1. Automatic 17% tip -- They add your tip to the bill and they fail to tell you this when they seat you. 2.  The service was terrible (see #1).   3.  The food was equal to frozen food you can buy in the supermarket.  Taco Bell would have been a slight improvement. 4.  Anyone who gives this place favorable review is either employed by the restaurant or doesn't get out much.

very touristy but perfect if you want to get dinner and have great seats to watch the fireworks. the food was good but nothing special. pretty standard for tex-mex. the margaritas were really good and fairly strong especially the strawberry margaritas. service was good.

During Summer 2006, my wife and I (with our two sons) had lunch at this restaurant a couple of times while we visited Navy Pier. The food wasn't great -- just good, which is fine in a touristy spot like Navy Pier. It's not like I was expecting a 'Lindo Mexican' (formerly of Lincoln Park) kind of excellence. So last Sunday (09/21/08) while visiting Navy Pier we decided to have lunch there again. I ordered the enchiladas and my wife the veggie burrito (kids had hotdogs/fries).  My first thought on seeing the food was 'what a large serving' considering it was lunchtime. But after TWO bites... I called my waiter over and sent that CRAP back! I have never in my 43 years ever.. EVER had such putrid food served to me. I would've enjoyed a dead rat better. The sauce was disgusting.. it tasted like generic tomato soup made by some fourth-world country in the 15th century. The 'steak' consisted off tiny bits (about a 1/4 the size of my fingernail) of some undetermined meat (hell, it might have been dead rat). This was rolled up in a tortilla that had the consistency of two week old, second-hand bread. While I was sending my food back, my wife was helping our sons get situated and then she took a bite of her food and I thought she was gonna projectile vomit like you see in the movies. She gagged so hard I thought she might have swallowed her tongue. Her 'veggie burrito' consisted of huge spoonfuls of guacamole and minced onion/tomato mixture served with tortilla chips and shredded lettuce that was so wilted it looked like it spent days in the rain before being left out to dry. Even our sons hot dogs were served on bread that was falling apart like it was days old (fortunately, they only eat the hot dogs anyway.. so the bread wasn't a concern.) I have eaten in restaurants all over the western hemisphere -- from N.America to S. America and a few islands in the Pacific -- and I have NEVER been served food that disgusting. Needless to say.. never again will I be eating at this restaurant.

Majorly a tourista thing, but when I was in the area after a movie and wanted to pretend to be a  Texan coming to the big city on vacation and watch the fireworks this past Saturday, it totally was the right setting. The food was good, as good as most tex-mex places in the city, and the view was great from the outdoor patio. We had perfect seats for the fireworks. I'd like to also point out that the service was actually VERY good considering if I worked at a place like that I would have a super sour attitude.  But, by all means do NOT try the mojito. I know it came from a mix bottle...the green color was tell tale. Yee-haw folks!!

I wouldn't normally even think to give this restaurant a review it is such a bland touristy place to begin with.... but man, did they treat me like shit!  I ate here for lunch with a couple friends and everything seemed normal enough. Like I said... nothing memorable. The waiter was pleasant enough. We ordered a plate of nachos to share and were munching on them as our food arrived. I checked mine out and was eyeing the green substance in a small plastic container on my plate wondering of its contents (salad dressing). Out of nowhere an employee pops up at our table and asks, "Is there a problem?" with some *major* attitude.. She is not our waiter or the hostess so I immediately assume she has the wrong table and tell her no. She informs me that I was looking at my food like I had a problem... I once again tell her that there is no problem and state that I will try very hard not to look strangely at my food anymore. She disbelievingly says "ok" and walks off...  She never did say who she was but I truly hope she is not management as she has much to improve on her people skills. There really was no "problem" with the food although it was abundant it lacked taste so I can't say it was bad. The nachos were decent. I had a chicken wrap and a friend had the fajita wrap. We both agreed they were less than wonderful. We each only ate half.  Perhaps my taste buds simply went into hibernation after being irrationally berated by a stranger.  Rating: Two stars for being less than average and -1 star for at least one employee without manners. Recommendations: Get the nachos, don't expect to be treated with any respect and you'll be fine.

Just visited this restaurant for lunch while stowling Navy Pier.  Although the menu is small, it offered just what I was looking for, nachos and quesadillas.  I loved the nachos so good.  I loved them so much I didn't have the quesadillas.  My boyfriend liked them though! The views from the outside seating area were great.  Our server was attentive and food came out promptly.  Oh and the margarita was pretty good, I have had better but it was nice a refreshing on a hot summer day!
This is a super good mexican place and they have outdoor seating that overlooks the pier!  The menu is small but the food is really good!  And the service is really fast!
